KnowledgeBase.Title: isSymbol
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex

Function.Description: The isSymbol function returns true is the argument is Symbol. Otherwise, it returns false.

Brief.Overview: The isSymbol Function returns true if the argument {obj} is a Symbol; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isSymbol function is used to query an object to see if it is of type Symbol. An alternate method would be to use the isType function using the Type argument as type Symbol.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex

Syntax.Return: If the object is type Symbol, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned
